item.title: Long Range Ethernet Goes Beyond The LAN
Advantages of a Wireless Business Continuity Plan
item.description: For businesses today, the difference between success and failure often comes down to a reliable internet connection. In the past, while important, telecom connections weren’t critical for daily operations. Now, with businesses relying on cloud-based applications and data storage, a lost connection can bring everything to a halt. While wired connections are generally dependable, they aren’t perfect. Downtime, whether due to equipment malfunctions or accidental cable cuts, can lead to significant financial setbacks.

item.title: Ethernet vs T1 in Under 3 Minutes
item.description: By: John Shepler Ethernet bandwidth services are generating a lot of interest, but are they truly superior to traditional T1 lines? Is switching from copper to fiber a wise decision financially? This brief comparison of Ethernet and T1 services will provide clarity. Interested in determining which connectivity and hosted services best meet your business needs? Get instant pricing and availability for Ethernet, T1, and other connectivity options.

item.title: DS3 Bandwidth Alternatives
item.description: DS3 WAN connections are a popular choice for businesses that need more bandwidth than T1 lines offer but aren’t ready for a full OC-3 fiber optic SONET service. However, exploring alternative options might be beneficial due to cost or performance considerations. There are several bandwidth options available today that might be a better fit than your existing DS3 connection. Let’s explore some alternatives. DS3 bridges the gap between copper wireline and fiber optic bandwidth services.
